articles.headline: What We’ve Learned About the Media Industry During This Election
articles.snippet: The story of the 2016 election is not one of new media replacing old media, but of both struggling to define their roles.
articles.abstract: The story of the 2016 election is not one of new media replacing old media, but of both struggling to define their roles.
articles.lead_paragraph: When the 2016 campaign began, legacy news organizations already faced dim industry projections. Slides in print revenue at newspapers and magazines were accelerating; online advertising, the escape plan for these businesses, teetered.

articles.headline: A Fever Dream of an Election
articles.snippet: Once upon a time, the fear was that it was shaping up to be a dull race. Then someone came down the escalator.
articles.abstract: Once upon a time, the fear was that it was shaping up to be a dull race. Then someone came down the escalator.
articles.lead_paragraph: Finally it’s over, or so it seems. We made it to Nov. 8 — which itself is a win. But did anyone catch the livery plates on that careening limo? Did that WikiLeak-ing, Weiner-crashing, Billy Bushing, Russian-hacking spectacle really just happen, or was it a figment of too many minds subjected to too much pandemonium over too long a campaign?

articles.headline: Narendra Modi Bans India’s Largest Currency Bills in Bid to Cut Corruption
articles.snippet: People flocked to A.T.M.s after the prime minister announced the crackdown, and experts predicted the prices of real estate and luxury items would fall.
articles.abstract: People flocked to A.T.M.s after the prime minister announced the crackdown, and experts predicted the prices of real estate and luxury items would fall.
articles.lead_paragraph: NEW DELHI — Prime Minister Narendra Modi fired a direct shot at India’s endemic corruption with a surprise move on Tuesday to ban the country’s largest currency bills, starting the next morning.
articles.byline: By Geeta Anand and Hari Kumar

articles.headline: Why Stock Markets, Initially Shaken, Went Up After Trump’s Victory
articles.snippet: American stocks rose in Wednesday trading, offering a respite from the wild ride in Europe and Asia.
articles.abstract: American stocks rose in Wednesday trading, offering a respite from the wild ride in Europe and Asia.
articles.lead_paragraph: After a sharp sell-off overnight in Asia, markets staged a recovery on Wednesday as investors shook off the shock of a Donald J. Trump presidency and began to focus on whether his mix of policies could spur a still-fragile global economic recovery.

articles.headline: Donald Trump Is Elected President in Stunning Repudiation of the Establishment
articles.snippet: His surprise victory ended an erratic and grievance-filled campaign that took direct aim at his own party and long-held ideals of American democracy.
articles.abstract: His surprise victory ended an erratic and grievance-filled campaign that took direct aim at his own party and long-held ideals of American democracy.
articles.lead_paragraph: Donald John Trump was elected the 45th president of the United States on Tuesday in a stunning culmination of an explosive, populist and polarizing campaign that took relentless aim at the institutions and long-held ideals of American democracy.
articles.byline: By Matt Flegenheimer and Michael Barbaro

articles.headline: Donald Trump’s Victory Promises to Upend the International Order
articles.snippet: For the first time since World War II, Americans choose a president who pledged to reverse the internationalism practiced by both parties.
articles.abstract: For the first time since World War II, Americans choose a president who pledged to reverse the internationalism practiced by both parties.
articles.lead_paragraph: JERUSALEM — Donald J. Trump’s stunning election victory on Tuesday night rippled way beyond the nation’s boundaries, upending an international order that prevailed for decades and raising profound questions about America’s place in the world.

articles.headline: Donald Trump Rode to Power in the Role of the Common Man
articles.snippet: Often met with scoffing disdain by wealthy elites and mainstream civic leaders, Mr. Trump delivered perhaps the greatest shock to the American political system in modern times.
articles.abstract: Often met with scoffing disdain by wealthy elites and mainstream civic leaders, Mr. Trump delivered perhaps the greatest shock to the American political system in modern times.
articles.lead_paragraph: Donald John Trump defied the skeptics who said he would never run, and the political veterans who scoffed at his slapdash campaign.

articles.headline: A Pennsylvania Town in Decline and Despair Looks to Donald Trump
articles.snippet: A blue-collar bastion that was a former Democratic stronghold vents its anger against Hillary Clinton and a changed world.
articles.abstract: A blue-collar bastion that was a former Democratic stronghold vents its anger against Hillary Clinton and a changed world.
articles.lead_paragraph: AMBRIDGE, Pa. — As the inevitability of Donald J. Trump’s victory played out Tuesday night on a television above Fred’s Divot bar, the men who by day carry pipes, hang drywall and drive locomotives watched the returns with mounting satisfaction.
